etymologies: late Middle English (in the sense ‘examine and ascertain the condition of’): from Anglo-Norman French surveier, from medieval Latin supervidere, from super- ‘over’ + videre ‘to see’. The early sense of the noun (late 15th century) was ‘supervision’

definitions: (of a person or their eyes) look carefully and thoroughly at (someone or something), especially so as to appraise them

examples.text: her green eyes surveyed him coolly

definitions: examine and record the area and features of (an area of land) so as to construct a map, plan, or description

examples.text: he surveyed the coasts of New Zealand

shortDefinitions: examine and record area and features of area of land so as to construct map or description

definitions: investigate the opinions or experience of (a group of people) by asking them questions

examples.text: 95% of patients surveyed were satisfied with the health service

shortDefinitions: investigate opinions or experience of group of people by asking them questions

definitions: investigate (behavior or opinions) by questioning a group of people

examples.text: the investigator surveyed the attitudes and beliefs held by residents

shortDefinitions: investigate behaviour or opinions by questioning group of people

definitions: a general view, examination, or description of someone or something

examples.text: the author provides a survey of the relevant literature

shortDefinitions: general view, examination, or description of person or thing

definitions: an investigation of the opinions or experience of a group of people, based on a series of questions.
shortDefinitions: investigation of opinions or experience of group of people

definitions: an act of surveying an area of land

examples.text: the flight involved a detailed aerial survey of military bases

shortDefinitions: act of surveying area of land

definitions: a map, plan, or detailed description obtained by a survey.
shortDefinitions: map, plan, or detailed description obtained by surveying area

definitions: a department carrying out the surveying of land
shortDefinitions: department carrying out surveying of land
